lines.content: Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
// PS I don't really like writing enterprise-grade code
protected static ArrayList<Task> internalTaskList = new ArrayList<>();
// this should be editable in a .config file, and give export options in future
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
System.out.println("\uD83D\uDCDC Found and loaded previously saved tasklist (from last session). " +
"Type \"nuke\" if you want to erase it.");
private static void loadSavedTasklist() throws IOException {
System.out.println("⚠ Error saving tasklist to disk. Check Logs.");

// A factory method pattern + ENUMS for all Command-type objects could prove to be very elegant.
// couldn't find appropriate date for input request will return null.
// consider initializing these constants from a .config file w/ hardcoded default fallback
public static final String SHELLPROMPT = String.format("%s@Cedar:~$ ", System.getProperty("user.name"));
// consider using classpath over abs_path to avoid gui packaging issues later on
// version-print detector, more fields to come ie. what's new box
// add more as dev goes on
super(ALIASES, "Add a task with an associated deadline");
System.out.println("⚠ Error adding deadline: do /by [date] not found.");
System.out.println("⚠ Error: malformed date or entered incorrectly. (Check spelling?)");
System.out.format("Added a new Deadline Task! Finish [%s] before: %s [%s]\n", content[0], content[1],
System.out.println("⚠ Error adding event: timestamp /at [date] not found.");
// considering reading date format from an usr-defined .config file
System.out.println("⚠ Error: malformed event date or entered incorrectly. (Check spelling?)");
System.out.format("Added a new Event Task! Attend event [%s] at: %s [%s]\n", content[0], content[1],
// wowie simulating human marking effort feels kind of cozy
System.out.format("Nice. I've marked this task as done: %s\n",
System.out.format("🔎 Search returned %d hit(s) for \"%s\".\n", matchingDatesList.size(), languageDate);
System.out.format("🔎 Search returned 0 hits for \"%s\".\n", searchPhrase);
//System.out.format("🔎 Search returned %d hit(s) for \"%s\".\n", matchingPhraseList.size(), searchPhrase);
System.out.println("Added a new todo task: " + content);
System.out.format("OK, I've marked this task as yet undone: %s\n",
System.out.println("Unrecognized. Check for typo(s) in commands.");
System.out.println("Type \"help\" for a brief list of available commands.");
System.out.println("Type \"help -d\" for a detailed list of available commands.");
// considering reading date format from an usr-defined .config file
// considering reading date format from an usr-defined .config file
public JsonElement serialize(LocalDate date, final Type typeOfSrc, JsonSerializationContext context) {
// works for all subclasses - tested: code coverage 100%
return (doneState ? "✓" : "☐"); // mark done task with X
